newsitem.title: USA: Pinkerton's Inc abandons planned acquisition.
newsitem.headline: Pinkerton's Inc abandons planned acquisition.

text.p: Pinkerton's Inc said Friday that it had ended discussions with Sensormatic Electronics Corp on the proposed acquisition of Sensormatic's Enterprise Accounts Division and central station non-retail monitoring business.
Pinkerton said the deal was quashed after an extensive due diligence investigation.
The deal was originally announced in May. Terms were not disclosed.

"We are moving forward immediately with the acquisition of high-quality integrators in our targeted geographic areas," Pinkerton Executive Vice President Michael Carter said in a statement. "We continue with our objective to complete the building of Pinkerton's U.S. systems integration division through internal growth and acquisitions as soon as possible."
